Description: Plaster bust of the god Serapis. A bust of Sarapis, with chiton and himation and wearing a modius, cast into a one-piece mould and incorporating a wooden spike, the top of which shows at the back, the pointed end extending from below the bust. The back of the bust has no detail and has been manipulated somewhat during the casting process. Buff-coloured plaster, painted yellow on the front.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV This is paired with the plaster Hadrian bust Terracotta 3510. Comparandum. Near, also in plaster, but much smaller: Pagenstecher 1923: pl. xlix: 4, from Hawara.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3031)
